Function.Description: The exp function returns e to the X power where X is the argument of the function and e is 2.71828.

Brief.Overview: The exp function computes the natural exponential of its argument.
Brief.Overview-Complex: The exp function returns e to the X power where X is the argument of the function and e is 2.71828.
Brief.Usage: The exp function is used to compute the natural exponential of a Number.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The exp function is used to determine the value of e to X power where the argument X is complex. Do not use if an immediate type, such as a real number, would suffice.

Syntax.Return: A complex number holding e to the X power.
